alert.note: Alert for Whitman (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 4:12AM PST until December 28 at 9:59PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Paradise Creek at Moscow affecting Whitman and Latah Counties. .Cooler temperatures and drier weather will allow Paradise Creek to continue falling through Thursday. For the Paradise Creek ...including Moscow...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...Paradise Creek at Moscow. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water will be up to the homes near the intersection of Bridge and Hillcrest. Intersection at 5th and Roosevelt will be flooded. Water will be out of the banks at the D Street bridge. Storm drains along Main Street will be backed up and overflowing. Mountainview Park will be flooded. Bike path along the creek near the University will be under 6 inches of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM PST Wednesday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The creek is expected to fall below flood stage by this evening and continue falling for the next several days. - Flood stage is 9.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 03/10/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM PST.
